Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) using Pd metal as the anode were fabricated for detection of CO in a flowing mixture of 0-4000 ppm CO, 50% H-2, 10% CO2 and 6% H2O vapor between 300 and 400 degreesC. When 20 mol% Sm3+-doped CeO2 (SDC) was used as the electrolyte, the Pd anode was subjected to a large and reversible change in the anodic-reaction resistance with the CO concentration.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases

Sentencas: This behavior brought about an almost linear relationship between the electromotive force (EMF) generated from the cell or the short-circuit current through the cell and the logarithm of the CO concentration.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases

Sentencas: In both signals, the minimum detectable CO concentration was 50 ppm, and the 90% response and 90% recovery times were about 60 s.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases

Sentencas: However, the EMF of the cell at a CO concentration of 0 ppm significantly deviated from the theoretical value, which made it difficult to obtain reproducible data.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases

Sentencas: In addition, the current signal of a few muA at a CO concentration of 4000 ppm was not large enough to monitor the CO concentration exactly.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases

Sentencas: The improvement of these problems could be achieved by using 25 mol% Y3+-doped BaCeO3 (BCY25) with higher ionic conduction as the electrolyte: the EMF of the cell at a CO concentration of 0 ppm was near the theoretical value; the current signal reached 66 muA at a CO concentration of 4000 ppm.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells that enable the detection of CO in reformed gases
